query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, 2 umile e alta più che creatura, 3 termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
query.result: 1 "Virgin Mother, daughter of your Son, 2 humble and exalted more than any creature, 3 fixed term of eternal counsel,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 tu se’ colei che l’umana natura 5 nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore 6 non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura.
query.result: 4 You are she who ennobled human nature 5 so much that its Maker 6 did not disdain to become its creature.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, 8 per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace 9 così è germinato questo fiore.
query.result: 7 In your womb love was rekindled, 8 through whose warmth in eternal peace 9 this flower has thus germinated.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Qui se’ a noi meridïana face 11 di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, 12 se’ di speranza fontana vivace.
query.result: 10 Here you are to us the noonday torch 11 of charity, and down below, among mortals, 12 you are the living fountain of hope.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Donna, se’ tanto grande e tanto vali, 14 che qual vuol grazia e a te non ricorre, 15 sua disïanza vuol volar sanz’ ali.
query.result: 13 Lady, you are so great and so worthy, 14 that whoever desires grace and does not turn to you, 15 his desire wants to fly without wings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 La tua benignità non pur soccorre 17 a chi domanda, ma molte fïate 18 liberamente al dimandar precorre.
query.result: 16 Your kindness not only helps 17 those who ask, but many times 18 freely anticipates the request.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 In te misericordia, in te pietate, 20 in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna 21 quantunque in creatura è di bontate.
query.result: 19 In you is mercy, in you is pity, 20 in you is magnificence, in you is gathered 21 whatever goodness is in a creature.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Or questi, che da l’infima lacuna 23 de l’universo infin qui ha vedute 24 le vite spiritali ad una ad una,
query.result: 22 Now this man, who from the lowest part 23 of the universe has seen up to here 24 the spiritual lives one by one,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 supplica a te, per grazia, di virtute 26 tanto, che possa con li occhi levarsi 27 più alto verso l’ultima salute.
query.result: 25 begs you, for grace, for so much virtue 26 that he may be able to raise himself with his eyes 27 higher towards the ultimate salvation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi 29 più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi 30 ti porgo, e priego che non sieno scarsi,
query.result: 28 And I, who never burned for my own seeing 29 more than I do for his, offer you all my prayers, 30 and I pray that they may not be scarce,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 perché tu ogne nube li disleghi 32 di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi, 33 sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi.
query.result: 31 so that you may unbind every cloud 32 of his mortality with your prayers, 33 so that the supreme pleasure may be revealed to him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi 35 ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, 36 dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi.
query.result: 34 Again I pray you, O queen, who can 35 whatever you wish, that you preserve his affections sound, 36 after so much seeing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani: 38 vedi Beatrice con quanti beati 39 per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani!».
query.result: 37 May your protection conquer human impulses: 38 see Beatrice with how many blessed ones 39 at my prayers fold their hands to you!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Li occhi da Dio diletti e venerati, 41 fissi ne l’orator, ne dimostraro 42 quanto i devoti prieghi le son grati;

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 indi a l’etterno lume s’addrizzaro, 44 nel qual non si dee creder che s’invii 45 per creatura l’occhio tanto chiaro.
query.result: 43 then they turned to the eternal light, 44 into which it is not to be believed that 45 the eye so clear can be sent by any creature.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii 47 appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, 48 l’ardor del desiderio in me finii.
query.result: 46 And I, who was approaching the end of all desires, 47 as I should, 48 brought the ardor of desire in me to an end.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, 50 perch’ io guardassi suso; ma io era 51 già per me stesso tal qual ei volea:
query.result: 49 Bernard motioned to me and smiled, 50 so that I would look up; but I was already 51 of myself such as he wished:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, 53 e più e più intrava per lo raggio 54 de l’alta luce che da sé è vera.
query.result: 52 for my sight, becoming pure, 53 entered more and more into the ray 54 of the high light that is true from itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio 56 che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, 57 e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio.
query.result: 55 From then on my sight was greater 56 than speech can show, which fails at such a sight, 57 and memory fails at such an outrage.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Qual è colüi che sognando vede, 59 che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa 60 rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
query.result: 58 Like one who sees in a dream, 59 that after the dream the impression of the passion 60 remains, and the rest does not return to the mind,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa 62 mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla 63 nel core il dolce che nacque da essa.
query.result: 61 such am I, for almost all of my vision 62 ceases, and still the sweetness born from it 63 distills in my heart.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Così la neve al sol si disigilla; 65 così al vento ne le foglie levi 66 si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 O somma luce che tanto ti levi 68 da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente 69 ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
query.result: 67 O supreme light that so far transcend 68 mortal concepts, restore to my mind 69 a little of what you appeared to be,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, 71 ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria 72 possa lasciare a la futura gente;

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria 74 e per sonare un poco in questi versi, 75 più si conceperà di tua vittoria.
query.result: 73 for, by returning somewhat to my memory 74 and by sounding a little in these verses, 75 more will be conceived of your victory.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi 77 del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, 78 se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi.
query.result: 76 I believe, because of the sharpness that I endured 77 from the living ray, that I would have been lost, 78 if my eyes had been turned away from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito 80 per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi 81 l’aspetto mio col valore infinito.
query.result: 79 And I remember that I was bolder 80 because of this to endure, so much that I joined 81 my sight with the infinite power.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi 83 ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, 84 tanto che la veduta vi consunsi!
query.result: 82 O abundant grace from which I presumed 83 to fix my gaze on the eternal light, 84 so much that I consumed my sight in it!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, 86 legato con amore in un volume, 87 ciò che per l’universo si squaderna:
query.result: 85 In its depths I saw that which is contained, 86 bound together with love in one volume, 87 that which is spread out throughout the universe:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 sustanze e accidenti e lor costume 89 quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo 90 che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume.
query.result: 88 substances and accidents and their properties 89 as if fused together, in such a way 90 that what I say is a simple glimmer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 La forma universal di questo nodo 92 credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, 93 dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo.
query.result: 91 The universal form of this knot 92 I believe I saw, because more broadly, 93 saying this, I feel that I rejoice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo 95 che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa 96 che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo.
query.result: 94 A single moment is a greater lethargy to me 95 than twenty-five centuries to the enterprise 96 that made Neptune marvel at the shadow of Argo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, 98 mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, 99 e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa.
query.result: 97 Thus my mind, completely suspended, 98 gazed fixedly, motionless and attentive, 99 and became ever more kindled with gazing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 A quella luce cotal si diventa, 101 che volgersi da lei per altro aspetto 102 è impossibil che mai si consenta;

Please translate each line literally into English.
103 però che ’l ben, ch’è del volere obietto, 104 tutto s’accoglie in lei, e fuor di quella 105 è defettivo ciò ch’è lì perfetto.
query.result: 103 because the good, which is the object of the will, 104 is all gathered in it, and outside of it 105 that which is perfect there is defective.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Omai sarà più corta mia favella, 107 pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante 108 che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella.
query.result: 106 Now my speech will be shorter, 107 even to what I remember, than that of an infant 108 who still wets his tongue at the breast.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Non perché più ch’un semplice sembiante 110 fosse nel vivo lume ch’io mirava, 111 che tal è sempre qual s’era davante;

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 ma per la vista che s’avvalorava 113 in me guardando, una sola parvenza, 114 mutandom’ io, a me si travagliava.
query.result: 112 but because the sight that was strengthened 113 in me by gazing, a single appearance, 114 as I changed, was transformed for me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Ne la profonda e chiara sussistenza 116 de l’alto lume parvermi tre giri 117 di tre colori e d’una contenenza;

Please translate each line literally into English.
118 e l’un da l’altro come iri da iri 119 parea reflesso, e ’l terzo parea foco 120 che quinci e quindi igualmente si spiri.
query.result: 118 and one from the other, like iris from iris, 119 seemed reflected, and the third seemed fire 120 that breathes equally from this side and that.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco 122 al mio concetto! e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, 123 è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’.
query.result: 121 Oh how short and how weak is speech 122 to my conception! And this, to what I saw, 123 is so much, that it is not enough to say ‘little’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, 125 sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta 126 e intendente te ami e arridi!
query.result: 124 O eternal light that abidest only in thyself, 125 understandest only thyself, and by thyself understood 126 and understanding lovest and smilest upon thyself!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Quella circulazion che sì concetta 128 pareva in te come lume reflesso, 129 da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
query.result: 127 That circling which appeared so conceived 128 in thee as reflected light, 129 somewhat examined by my eyes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, 131 mi parve pinta de la nostra effige: 132 per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo.
query.result: 130 within itself, of its own color, 131 seemed to me painted with our image: 132 for which reason my sight was wholly absorbed in it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige 134 per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, 135 pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
query.result: 133 As is the geometer who applies himself wholly 134 to measuring the circle, and does not find, 135 by thinking, that principle which he needs,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 tal era io a quella vista nova: 137 veder voleva come si convenne 138 l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova;

Please translate each line literally into English.
139 ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne: 140 se non che la mia mente fu percossa 141 da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne.
query.result: 139 but my own wings were not for this: 140 except that my mind was struck 141 by a flash of light in which its desire came to be.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa; 143 ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, 144 sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa,

Please translate each line literally into English.
145 l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle.
query.result: 145 by the love that moves the sun and the other stars.
